attributes.action: Hold a post referendum opinion poll on key factors before the exit negotiations.
attributes.background: Public opinion and information have been misrepresented in a highly complex question. Public opinion of key facts (Immigration, Economy, Politics, etc.) should be found before any exit negotiations can take place, to ensure accurate and fair representation of the true feelings of the population.
attributes.additional_details:
Evidence of misinterpretation of facts has been shown by those leading the campaigns. Public information and opinion has also been shown to be misinformed, given social media trends (i.e #Regretzit) and search engine results (i.e. What is the EU? / What are the results of leaving the EU?) taking place post the referendum result.

A full and open opinion poll should be carried out to find a better understanding of UK opinion on a wider number of topics involved in the exit debate.

attributes.action: Work Permit For Athletes Easy Accepted Aslong As Team Provides Proof Of Contact!
attributes.background: If we do not grant athletes easy workpermits then the best football league in the world will suffer. This will mean the quality of the league will drop and tourists that come over to watch the games may find alternative leagues and teams too follow which will then effect local companies

attributes.action: Consider independent representatives in all future referendum campaigns.
attributes.background: For all future referendum campaigns, we would like to see the appointment of independent and impartial representatives debate both sides of the argument (with the budget split evenly).  We feel that by doing this, each sides argument is based on fact and not for political gain.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition has been set up in the wake of the European referendum whereby both sides of the debate contained large degrees of scaremongering and, retrospectively it would appear a number of false statements.

We feel that the clear choice in a democratic society is for independent (non-political) representatives to debate both sides in future (based on facts) and with no bias.

attributes.action: Raise maximum sentencing on those committing vile racism offences on citizens.
attributes.background: After recent events in the UK, a wave of hatred and racism has overshadowed the democracy to leave the EU. 100's of crimes of online and physical racism have been carried out particularly on EU citizens. With a new future for the country ahead, we need to stamp out this evil with increased severity.
attributes.additional_details: I can speak for the majority of people from both sides of the recent EU referendum who will condemn these vile attacks. Our country should be applauded and renowned for its diversity. Any form of racism against any citizen of any country residing in the UK should be deplored, and an increase in judicial sentencing on such crimes should be approved. Regardless of what world we live in, the UK should welcome all that arrive in this great democracy.

attributes.action: Government should give 350 UK charities 1 million each,
attributes.background: I believe in Our Country, I believe in Values and Standards. Likewise I believe in Charity.  Instead of sending 350 million per week to The EU give 350 UK Charities 1 million each.
attributes.additional_details: Have worked in Charity Shops Regularly also Donate When Able To.

attributes.action: British people want more funding put into: science, public services & education.
attributes.background:
We all know that our public services (e.g. NHS) are under stress, that more science means more advancement and that more education means less misinformation.
So help to try and get more funding from the British government for these areas.

attributes.action: Future referendums to be subject to a 40% of eligible voters threshold.
attributes.background: A petition to require that all future referendums which would trigger constitutional change should be subject to both an absolute majority of those voting AND a 40% of eligible voters threshold.

attributes.action: Start schools later
attributes.background: Make schools start and finish later so students can concentrate better

attributes.action: If circumstances call for a second EU referendum, voting should be compulsory.
attributes.background:
If another referendum happens but with a similar, or worse, lower turnout - what validates the second result anymore than the first result? 
Australia uses compulsory voting every general election as it delivers a strong mandate for government. 100% turnout would ensure public respect for results.
attributes.additional_details:
As there is already an £80 fine in place for failing to register on the electoral roll, an £80 for failing to turn up to vote is not much of a further stretch. 

Voters remain free to spoil ballots, or not mark a preference, as a form of protest voting - they simply have to turn up. 

We have a few months before David Cameron resigns and athe least a year or so before we REALLY leave the EU. So many have expressed regret for voting out.. the future is still salvageable, but we have to act fast.

attributes.action: Increase funding to engage those 18-24 in the voting process
attributes.background: Turnout has fallen from over 60% in the early 1990s to an average of 40% and is estimated around 36% for Brexit. More funding is needed for neutral education on the system and process.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the British Election Study, the proportion of registered 18 to 24-year-olds turning out to vote has consistently been below every other age group since the 1970s.

Eurobarometer suggested that young British adults are among the least engaged with the political process when comparing their peers across Europe.

Young people do not only vote less, but research by the Electoral Commission suggests they are less likely to be on the electoral register than other age groups.

attributes.action: Over 60's should not be able to vote on our generations issues!
attributes.background: Anything from the EU vote to who becomes the new leader of the country are all decisions which will affect the current and young generation most. We are the ones who'll be living and dealing with the changes allot more. People who are older don't have to worry so much, our youth are your future!
attributes.additional_details: The youth are the future of the nation however the voices of the past get heard allot more! this has to stop.

attributes.action: Create basic check to ensure voters understand what they are voting about/on
attributes.background:
One of the benefits of being a British citizen is the right to vote, and to know that your vote has the power to influence laws, policies, taxes and more. 

It should be the duty of the government to British democracy to ensure and check that voters understand what they are voting on/about.
attributes.additional_details:
One example: an increase in the Google search term "What is the EU?" within the UK, the day after these searchers potentially voted on it. 
http://www.techinsider.io/what-is-the-eu-is-top-google-search-in-uk-after-brexit-2016-6

attributes.action: Add political history and international relations to the school curriculum.
attributes.background: A small number of people knew about how a democracy works at the end of the EU referendum. Even fewer understood what benefits the eu gave and the cost of having it. By adding how Britain creates and maintains relationships and political ideologies to the curriculum we should increase that number.
attributes.additional_details: I think evidence for the need for politics to be added is the large number of people asking for a second referendum because it didn't go their way. These people clearly do not know how a democracy works and they should. There also needs to be teaching into the benefits of international relations and the benefits each nation gives to the UK as well as how those relationships are formed and maintained.I propose they are added into PSHE lessons before the end of formal secondary education at 16.

attributes.action: To strengthen Sections 28 to 32 of the Crime and Disorder Act 1998 (Anti-Racism)
attributes.background:
The result of the EU referendum has lead to incidents of racist abuse.
UK immigrants, residents, and foreign nationals would benefit from reassurance and the strengthening of protection at this time. The government have an opportunity to strengthen the sentencing powers in relation to racial crime.
attributes.additional_details:
In addition to a heightened period of public concern, tension, and political unrest; the tenor and rhetoric of the 'Leave campaign' in relation to immigration may result in a perception and presumption that the public airing of racist comments are an acceptable expression of views.

Evidence of some racist incidents can be found here: https://www.facebook.com/sarah.leblanc.718/media_set?set=a.10101369198638985.223406919&type=3

attributes.action:
-Extend EU exit interim period to 5years.
-Final Decision Referendum in Year 5.
attributes.background: The EU referendum was too close to be conclusive, and the future of the UK too uncertain to leave the EU in 2 years. We the undersigned request that the interim exit period be extended to 5 years with a Final Decision Referendum taking place in Year 5. We do not want this http://bit.ly/28TVrjb

attributes.action: let Australian and other Commonwealth countries practice Nursing in the UK
attributes.background: Let countries such as Australia be able to come to the UK and practice Nursing unlike the current law of only letting EU nurses practice with out having to re-training

attributes.action: Propose the EU a unified welfare system for unemployed  EU migrants.
attributes.background: European migrants, are attracted to Britain because of the generosity of its welfare system. If the EU shares common rights and laws for workers, then this should also include a common welfare system to stop the abuse of the welfare system and public resources in Britain.
attributes.additional_details: A unified welfare system would put a stop to the abuse of the British welfare system and public services from migrants, which is why so many people voted for BREXIT.

attributes.action: Renegotiate a better deal with the EU before a 2nd referendum
attributes.background: The Government should return to the negotiating table with the EU to attempt to secure a better deal for the UK to remain, acceptable to the British public, which could then be offered to the British people in a 2nd referendum BEFORE Article 50 of the Lisbon treaty is invoked.
attributes.additional_details: David Cameron negotiated the deal with the EU from a position of weakness, by declaring beforehand that he wanted to remain. The referendum result has resulted in a general acceptance within the EU that change is needed. Now that it is clear to Europe that we WILL leave under the present conditions, we should offer the EU a 2nd referendum IF AND ONLY IF a more acceptable deal, addressing voters key concerns over immigration, can be offered to the British Electorate.

attributes.action: Parliament must not recess until there is a  ratified plan post-referendum
attributes.background: The electorate needs leadership and understanding. Parliament must sit until this is achieved. All facts and assertions must be independently verified and it must be a contempt of Parliament to knowingly supply, support or provide inaccurate or misleading information.
attributes.additional_details: The UK is in danger of disintegration. Leadership is needed.

attributes.action: Independence For The South West Of England Creating The Kingdom Of Wessex.
attributes.background: I am sick of politicians In London letting the South West Rot, Not providing enough money for better education, updating infrastructure and stimulating enough jobs or housing for the people like me who was born in the South West and will die in the South West. Now it is time for Independence.
attributes.additional_details: 1) We need updated High speed rail Infrastructure but the government won't spend a penny because we are not worth it despite Devon alone creating over £1Billion in Tourist revenue each year. We need fast and effective rail networks to keep this growing, not clapped out rickety junk. 2) Have a look around the South West town or city you live in and you can tell there is a massive lack of funding for everything. Not enough police on the streets, or enough to even investigate crime any crime.

attributes.action: Offer all pro-EU British citizens a grant to relocate to Europe.
attributes.background: Any current British citizen not wanting to live under UK governance should be offered a grant to relocate to an EU country. By doing so they forfeit forever all privileges afforded by the UK - such as free health care, pensions, disability benefits, social housing etc.

attributes.action: Stop all future referendums from July 2016
attributes.background: Referendums cause division, animosity and pull the country apart.

attributes.action: Have the EU referendum for 28.8% that didn't vote, teens & British residents.
attributes.background: Only a quarter (26.74%) of Britain voted to LEAVE the EU. 28.8% registered voters, millions who couldn't register, 16-17 year old Brits, and UK residents, have had no say. Democracy is not a privilege of the few, and the EU referendum is incomplete and invalid currently & it must be completed.

attributes.action: Create an independent cross-party & cross-industry task force to manage Brexit
attributes.background: Leaving the EU is such a big deal. There needs to be an independent body or committee tasked to re-negotiate a new deal that represents all UK citizens & UK businesses. This task force should have cross-party & industry-wide representation to ensure the re-negotiation with the EU is fair & balanced.

attributes.action: to create a house of lords with 100 ELECTED members
attributes.background: austerity should of started with the amount we waste on the nearly 900 peers in the house of lords. america has 535 politicians in both houses it is time to reduce our politicians.

attributes.action: Hold a 2nd Referendum on the EU requiring all registered voters to cast a vote.
attributes.background: In the first vote only 37.44% of registered voters decided the long term future of the UK. This is not true Democracy.

attributes.action: support china's claim over the south china sea
attributes.background: China's claim over the south china sea has historic routes and china has pushed for countries to recognize its rightful claim to the south china sea. Thus far however the UK has refused to do so. The UK should recognize China's claim over it to both strengthen ties and recognize a historical claim.

attributes.action: Increase the HM Government Petition Response and Action Commitment
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to recognise the scale of opinion over lawful and reasonable public interest matters with the provision of additional petition signature number milestones.
attributes.additional_details: It is proposed that a parliamentary debate is held for petitions achieving 1 million signatures and positive change is instigated for petitions achieving 10 million signatures.

attributes.action: Make York a union with London to remain in the EU
attributes.background: York voted to remain in the EU by 58%. This is the historical capital of the North of England and was the second city until the industrial revolution. York can develop a second financial and political centre and should join London to stay in the EU.

attributes.action: Make anyone over the age of 50 unable to vote in a Second EU Election
attributes.background:
Recently the Elderly Population of this Country has been able to Dictate over the Young Generation of this great nation.
Lets make sure that the People that are going to be affected by Brexit and other elections the most decide.
Also to make the system equal, by lowering the minimum age to 15.

attributes.action: Call for a referendum in N.Ireland to decide if it remains part of the UK
attributes.background: The people of Northern Ireland have clearly decided that they want to remain a part of the European Union. Nigel Farage has lied to us, we want justice. We, the people of Northern Ireland, want to be freed. We ask that we can be allowed a referendum on the basis of our vote on the EU referendum.

attributes.action: A referendum for England to leave to United Kingdom.
attributes.background: This is an action created in the hope that, like a Scottish independence referendum, would enable England to remain within the EU.

attributes.action: Do not allow a second referendum on the EU to take place within the next 5 years
attributes.background: The nation has spoken and the result has been determined. Let's not change the rules after the fact.

attributes.action: Unite the country! An enquiry into the existing divide in the voting class
attributes.background: The UK on the 23rd June 2016 voted to leave the EU. The country had prior to, been subjected to scaremongering, distortion of facts and in general a politics filled with hate, divide and manipulation.
attributes.additional_details: In the aftermath of the vote, we awoke to a country on the verge on a breakup, with calls for a 2nd EU Referendum, a petition for the declaration of London's  independence and of course the call for a 2nd Scottish Referendum. We believe there is an urgent need for the UK Parliament to act and to prioritise the need to unite the country.We urge Parliament to examine the cause of the stark divide in society as reflected by the results of the EU Referendum by setting up a panel of enquiry.

attributes.action: Enact legislation to match EU funding for areas defined as Economically Deprived
attributes.background: Legislate guaranteeing to match (and increase in line with the Retail Price Index) current EU funding for areas defined using the EU model as Economically Deprived, post exit from the EU in 2018. This to be in addition to current levels of government investment in such areas and not replacing it.
attributes.additional_details:
This is to ensure financial promises made during the Leave campaign are not forgotten and to maintain investment and growth for the populations of such Economically Deprived areas.
E.g. The total European Regional Development Fund for the 2014-2020 funding period is €3.6bn.

attributes.action: Consider The City Of London as a free independent state. Remaining in the EU
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum decision and rumours of Scotland and Ireland. The United Kingdom has become more divided than ever. It is time for London to stand alone. We ask that the government consider the feasibility of London standing alone and remaining in the EU

attributes.action: Allow UK residents to vote in parliament elections and referendums.
attributes.background: After 5 years of continuous  residence people should be allowed to vote to have an influence on changes that will affect their lifes and residence in the  UK

attributes.action: Give Bristol, Cambridge and other remain areas the chance to remain in the EU
attributes.background:
Scotland and London have significantly voted to remain. As such actions are being taken to protect their democratic decision. 

Other parts of the UK have also strongly voted to remain and in any devolution options should have the option to join the parts of the UK that choose to remain in the EU
attributes.additional_details:
Scotland are securing their right to have a 2nd referendum and London has a petition going strongly.

Certain areas and cities have overwhelmingly voted to remain in the EU, including Gibraltar, Northern Ireland, Manchester, Oxford, Brighton and more. These areas should not have their British identity stripped in devolution without choosing what their new identity will be.

attributes.action: Allow legal British permanent residents to vote in referendums after 5 years.
attributes.background: Not everyone living in Britain who meets the citizenship requirements wants to become a British citizen immediately. Permanent residents who have been living and working in the UK for the past 5 years should be afforded the right to vote in a referendum as it pertains to their future as well.
attributes.additional_details: A full list of citizenship requirements can be found at https://www.gov.uk/becoming-a-british-citizen/check-if-you-can-apply

attributes.action: Make UK election/referendum process compulsory in the national curriculum.
attributes.background: It is evident from many media reports after the recent EU referendum and following local/general elections, that a significant percentage of UK residents do not fully understand election/referendum processes. It reasonably follows that UK-wide education is required to remedy this.
attributes.additional_details: Too many references to mention in media of all natures including popularly watched/listened to television/radio channels and social media networks.

attributes.action: Create an online voting system using NI numbers as identication to vote
attributes.background: I believe that a better voting system would involve using the Internet as a platform as more people would come forward to vote as it has easier access and by using the NI numbers everyone with have a unique number in which to cast their vote.

attributes.action: Make discrimination against homeless people a lawfully recognised hate crime
attributes.background: A hate crime is defined in British law as an act of violence or hostility directed at someone because of who they are yet homeless people are not covered by this law. We want new legislation to further prosecute people who commit hate crimes against homeless people.
attributes.additional_details: One year 52% of homeless people suffered from violence (Source: Crisis). Whilst this in itself is a criminal offence it is not further punishable under the Criminal Justice Act 2003. We would also like to have police support and advice to be more widely available for homeless people. Many homeless people are afraid to report incidents to police and we would like change this.

attributes.action: Liverpool to hold their own referendum on leaving England.
attributes.background:
Liverpool has always felt foreign and disconnected from the rest of England. In the aftermath of England leaving the European Union and Liverpool voting to remain We should have our indepence from England. 
After all the EU had done more this city in the last 20 years than anyone in Westminster.

attributes.action: Mandate gov't to create a non partisan advisory panel for the Brexit process
attributes.background: Mandate the government to create an independent advisory body of experts (across finance, business, politics, academia etc) to support and advise on the Brexit process - to ensure the best result for the British people. Advisory Council to represent all professional spheres.
attributes.additional_details:
On June 23rd 2016, the UK voting populace voted at the EU referendum to leave the European Union - with a simple majority of approx 52%. Following this, the Prime Minister has indicated he will step aside for a Brexit government to lead the country to invoke the leaving process.
A new government will require the support and expertise of a non-political advisory body, to bring the best research and knowledge in achieving the most beneficial Brexit for the British, EU and global populations.

attributes.action: Maximum voting age for national referendums
attributes.background:
Referendum results affect the country in the long-term. Therefore, only voters that are present for the consequences of the vote should be eligible to vote.

The undersigned propose to use a limit of 15 years less than the average life expectancy.

attributes.action: Let 14-18 year olds vote in second EU referendum
attributes.background: It's their future it's affecting, let them have a say! 14-18 year olds to vote in second EU referendum!

attributes.action: Every referendum must include a 'No Confidence in the Government' option
attributes.background: The Brexit vote was 52% leave 48% remain. A very small element of protest voting against the current government could have changed the result.

attributes.action: London, Northern Ireland and Scotland to leave the UK and remain in the EU
attributes.background: London, NI and Scotland all seem to be diverging socially, economically and politically from the rest of England.  Neither they nor the rest of England can in any way claim to represent each others views, so maybe it is time to split.

attributes.action: Allow Scotland to hold another referendum.
attributes.background:
Britain is currently backing a Brexit. The live results show Scotland is clearly not in favour of leaving the EU.

Due to Britain's relationship with the EU having changed since Scotland's referendum took place, it is only fair Scotland are allowed another referendum due to circumstantial changes.

attributes.action: Ban ice cream vans
attributes.background:
Ice cream vans are a nuisance to many people with their noise day after day, especially to housebound and those bringing up children who bear an additional burden of being pestered.

They are the least regulated of any trade in Britain, allowed door to door.

Putting up with them must end.
attributes.additional_details:
"Noise from ice-cream vans can be unwanted and intrusive." South Northamptonshire Council

"Noise from ice-cream vans is unwanted, intrusive and pollutes the environment in which we live in." Neighbours from Hell in Britain 

"aggressive selling.. should be banned" Noise Abatement Society

In 2014 in New York City alone: 1,804 complaints specifically about ice cream van music.
